identificationModule.briefTitle: Contrast Induced Acute Kidney in Patients With Acute Stroke

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Computed tomographic angiography (CTA) is recommended for identifying eligible patient with acute ischemic stroke (AIS) to receieve endovascular treatment. We are going to conduct this prospective corhot study to observe if sequential use contrast in CTA examination and in endovascular treatment will cause acute kidney injury.

armGroups.label: CTA
armGroups.description: Patients with AIS only receieved cerebral CTA exam.

armGroups.label: CTA+DSA
armGroups.description: Patients with AIS receieved cerebral CTA, followed by endovascular treatment with the guidence of digital substration angiography (DSA).

primaryOutcomes.description: Contrast-induced acute kidney injury was defined as a relative increase of 25% or an absolute increase of 0.3 mg/dL (28.2mol/L) in the serum creatinine level at 48 hours following angiography

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* All patients who are suspected with AIS.
* Non-contrast head CT excludes intracranial hemorrhage.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Lacking of pre-CTA Creatinine
* Lacking of post-angiography Creatinine with 24-48 hours
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: All patients who are suspected with AIS. Non-contrast head CT excludes intracranial hemorrhage. Patients who receieve CTA or CTA+DSA will be included in this study.

locations.facility: The First Affiliated Hospital of Nanjing Medical University

references.citation: Jia ZY, Wang SX, Zhao LB, Cao YZ, Shi HB, Liu S. Risk of Acute Kidney Injury with Consecutive, Multidose Use of Iodinated Contrast in Patients with Acute Ischemic Stroke. AJNR Am J Neuroradiol. 2019 Apr;40(4):652-654. doi: 10.3174/ajnr.A5959. Epub 2019 Jan 24.
